description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.
author: Matthew Green - @mgreen27
Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
frack113
false_positives: Custom applications use renamed binaries adding slight change to binary name. Typically this is easy to spot and add to whitelist
PsExec installed via Windows Store doesn't contain original filename field (False negative)
name: Potential Defense Evasion Via Rename Of Highly Relevant Binaries
query: (((winlog.event_data.Description:"Execute processes remotely") OR (Product:"Sysinternals PsExec") OR (winlog.event_data.Description:(Windows\ PowerShell* OR pwsh*)) OR (winlog.event_data.OriginalFileName:("powershell.exe" OR "pwsh.dll" OR "powershell_ise.exe" OR "psexec.exe" OR "psexec.c" OR "psexesvc.exe" OR "cscript.exe" OR "wscript.exe" OR "mshta.exe" OR "regsvr32.exe" OR "wmic.exe" OR "certutil.exe" OR "rundll32.exe" OR "cmstp.exe" OR "msiexec.exe" OR "reg.exe"))) AND (NOT process.executable.text:("*\\powershell.exe" OR "*\\pwsh.exe" OR "*\\powershell_ise.exe" OR "*\\psexec.exe" OR "*\\psexec64.exe" OR "*\\PSEXESVC.exe" OR "*\\cscript.exe" OR "*\\wscript.exe" OR "*\\mshta.exe" OR "*\\regsvr32.exe" OR "*\\wmic.exe" OR "*\\certutil.exe" OR "*\\rundll32.exe" OR "*\\cmstp.exe" OR "*\\msiexec.exe" OR "*\\reg.exe")))
